thread.title: Colloca Estate Winery: Another Grape Time Waiting for You This Weekend
thread.title_full: Colloca Estate Winery: Another Grape Time Waiting for You This Weekend

author: Kenneth Warner, blogger
title: Colloca Estate Winery: Another Grape Time Waiting for You This Weekend
text:
I know I’ve told you about this neighbor of mine before – and they have aged very nicely over the last year or so – both the wines and the place. Colloca Estate Winery in Fair Haven (where the state park is) hosts their Annual Harvest Festival this Saturday. And, believe me, if you want to find a way to spend a lazy Autumn Saturday afternoon, this is it!
Located just off Rt. 104A on West Bay Road in the Village of Fair Haven, which is just east of here, it’s a convenient, yet out of the way attraction. I know you can make it there in just a little over an hour. I drive out to our cabin next door to the vineyard almost every weekend.
The actual fest starts at noon, but the tasting room, dominated by a huge and cozy fireplace and a great view of the pond, opens at 11:00. Activities include Estate Tours for the 100 acre site and of the 900 feet of great frontage on the Bay at 1:00 and 3:00. They’ve got music at 2:00 and 4:00 and Food and Vendors on site all afternoon. And of course, wine tastings!
And in case you get hungry from all this activity, their menu includes everything from corn crab chowder to pulled pork sliders with apple slaw … and wood fired pizza and Panini’s to cheese and charcuterie platters.
They’re even having a pumpkin carving.
But the stars of the show are the wines. Yum. I’m particularly fond of the reds … cabernet to die for.
Leaf peeping is available, at no extra charge. And, if you go, wave as you go by!
